headline.main: Curious Scene in Theodore Parker's Church in Boston--News from Mr. Parker.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Boston Atlas, 20. Services were held as usual yesterday, at Music Hall, before the Twenty-eight Congregational Society. Before the discourse commenced, the Clerk of the Society, who assists in most of the services by reading hymns, Scripture, and announcements,

docs.snippet: Up to the tine of going to press, nothing had been heard of the Ocean Queen and the Kangaroo, due at this port, with details of the European news telegraphed from Quebec, and published yesterdav morning. The Persia, which left Liverpool on the llth,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Up to the tine of going to press, nothing had been heard of the Ocean Queen and the Kangaroo, due at this port, with details of the European news telegraphed from Quebec, and published yesterdav morning. The Persia, which left Liverpool on the llth, with three days later advices, is also now about due, with full and reliable particulars of the great battle of Magenta.

docs.snippet: PREPARATIONS FOR THE FOURTH OF JULY.-The Joint Committee of the Common Council charged with the preparations for the celebration of the Fourth of July, met at 3 P. M. yesterday. The SubCommittee on Fire works reported in favor of request ing Messrs....
docs.lead_paragraph: PREPARATIONS FOR THE FOURTH OF JULY.-The Joint Committee of the Common Council charged with the preparations for the celebration of the Fourth of July, met at 3 P. M. yesterday. The SubCommittee on Fire works reported in favor of request ing Messrs. J. G J. EDGE Co.

headline.main: The Famine In Fayal-Letter from the United States Consul.

docs.lead_paragraph: At the meeting held in Boston, June 16, to devise means for aiding the sufferers by famine in Fayal, F. E. PAPKER, Esq., read the following communication from the United States Consul at the Azores: FRIENDS AND FELLOW COUNTRYMEN: The time has arrived when great efforts must be made to avert from the inhanitants of this district the horrors of famine, and wishing to promote the good work beyond my

headline.main: ADDITIONAL FROM EUROPE.; INTERESTING CORRESPONDENCE. ARRIVAL OF THE SAXONIA. European Journals One Day Later.

docs.lead_paragraph: The screw steamship Saxonia, Capt. EHLERS, from Havrc, by way of Southampton, arrived at this port early yesterday morning. She left Southampton on the 4th instant, so that her news has been anticipated by the Europe. We find, however, various matters of interest in our London files of June 4, which, with our Paris Correspondence, we subjoin.

docs.snippet: DISCHARGE OF THE ORION'S CREW. - The two Lieutenants of the U. S. sloop-of-war Marion were yesterday examined as witnesses before United States Commissioner BRIDGHAM, in the case of the alleged slaver bark Orion. The mate, supercargo and crew were...
docs.lead_paragraph: DISCHARGE OF THE ORION'S CREW. - The two Lieutenants of the U. S. sloop-of-war Marion were yesterday examined as witnesses before United States Commissioner BRIDGHAM, in the case of the alleged slaver bark Orion. The mate, supercargo and crew were all present ; the latter were all down-east looking sailors.

docs.snippet: Probably the first consequence of Mr. DELAVAN'S inauguration as Street Inspector will be a decided increase in the bills of mortality. If this should be the case, we must beg our readers not to be alarmed. It will be the best "first proof" which Mr....
docs.lead_paragraph: Probably the first consequence of Mr. DELAVAN'S inauguration as Street Inspector will be a decided increase in the bills of mortality. If this should be the case, we must beg our readers not to be alarmed. It will be the best "first proof" which Mr. DELAVAN can give of his fitness for the post which he is to fill.
